FuncDef:
The bridge-domain command creates a bridge domain (BD) and displays the BD view.
The undo bridge-domain command deletes a BD. The bridge-domain command creates a bridge domain (BD) and displays the BD view. The undo bridge-domain command deletes a BD. By default, no bridge domain is created. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a bridge domain.
The value is an integer
ranging from 1 to 16777215.

ExtraInfo: On a VXLAN network, a BD is created as a Layer 2 broadcast domain used to forward VXLAN data packets.
